text: Additionally, HCMV enhances the activity of the cap-binding unit eIF4E [88] and also activates rictor, the kinase of Akt S473 [89] . Remarkably, both the raptor complex (mTORC1) and the rictor complex (mTORC2) can mediate an inhibitory phosphorylation of 4E-BP and a stimulatory phosphorylation of p70S6K. This indicates that upon HCMV infection the substrate specificity of rictor and raptor is modified, correlating with a beneficial rictor-mediated Akt activation.
